Description: Fragment of belly of painted pottery amphora: remains of three feet (hooves) of wild goat; to the left, dot rosette; below, base line with red line through centre.Brown clay, Munsell 7.5YR 5/4 (brown), with fine mica, black and white inclusions.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Tell Dafana, "Qasr", east annex (G), chamber 18
Curator's comments: Cook (CVA British Museum 8, p. 57, II.2) catalogues this fragment as being from the shoulder of a large bowl, cf, H. Prinz, Funde aus Naukratis, p. 122. Compare this fragment with the Dinos from Italy (Boardman 1998, 157 Abb. 299) and the shoulder handle amphora from Berezan (Inv. Nr. B408, Walter-Karydi 1973, Taf. 112 Nr. 918).
The Findspot number '18' has been scratched inside.
Bibliographic references: CVA British Museum 8 / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum: Great Britain 13, British Museum 8 (P. 57, II. 2)
Weber 2012 / Untersuchungen zur archaischen griechischen Keramik aus anderen ägyptischen Fundorten (TD 95)
Leclère and Spencer 2014 / Tell Dafana Reconsidered: The Archaeology of an Egyptian Frontier Town (p.210)
